title: ‘Come together’ Sunak tells Conservatives after twin by-election blow
description: Rishi Sunak has called on British conservatives to ‘come together’, after a bruising set of by-election defeats in Wellingborough and Kingswood.

title: Reform leader rejects an election pact with Conservatives
description: Richard Tice rules out a collaboration with Rishi Sunak as Tories fear the general election becoming a ‘slow-moving car crash’

title: Wellingborough proves you don't have to look hard to find broad disillusionment with politics
description: The stunning Labour swing in the by-election shows the party has become a receptacle for some voter disenchantment over the cost of living, the state of high street and the NHS.

title: Leader predicts Dudley Council is ‘doomed’ if review fails
description: DUDLEY'S leader laid out in stark terms the need for change at the council saying without reform the authority is ‘doomed’.

title: How A Recession And By-Election Misery Sent Rishi Sunak Back To Square One
description: Election expert Sir John Curtice said the Tories were “staring defeat in the face at the general election”, not least because the party is leaking voters to both Labour and Reform UK. The right-wing party secured 10% of the vote in Kingswood and 13% in ...

title: Wounded Sunak prepares income tax cut gamble after Reform by-election surge
description: Reform came third in both by elections, achieving 10 per cent of the poll in Kingswood and 13 per cent in Wellinborough, alarming some Tory MPs. They have called on Sunak to be “more Conservative” in order to win back Tory voters who stayed at home and ...

title: Sunak faces conflicting calls over Tory path forward after bruising byelections
description: Loudest voices urge further tack to right after Reform UK gains but moderates argue general election can only be won on centre ground

title: Reform and recession have robbed Rishi of the chance to exploit Labour chaos
description: The Prime Minister says a vote for Richard Tice’s party is a vote to put Keir Starmer into No 10 but the public aren’t listening

title: Rishi Sunak faces mutinous Tory party after by-election losses
description: Danny Kruger and Miriam Cates, the co-leaders of the New Conservatives faction of right-wing Tory MPs, also issued a damning statement accusing Sunak of presiding over “consensus politics” that centred on “high taxes, low security, managed decline”.

title: Politics live: Backbench Tories deliver message to Rishi Sunak after double by-election defeat
description: If there was any doubt among Conservatives about the danger posed by Reform UK, Thursday's by-election results helped to provide some clarity. Many wondered whether the polls - which had the Reform vote share at about 10% - were overestimating the party's ...

title: Labour’s by-election victories are historic, but ultimately shallow
description: Kingswood was always likely to deliver a Labour victory – and the seat is one of those that, if the next general election were being held on the current parliamentary boundaries, Labour would be expected to win if it was on course for an overall majority. It was won with ease. Labour enjoyed a 16 per cent swing from the Conservatives.

title: Tory members would choose me as leader, says Nigel Farage
description: Nigel Farage has said Conservative members would choose him as their leader over Rishi Sunak, after Reform UK had its best ever by-elections. Mr Farage, Reform's honorary president, said he would "have to" eventually end up in the same party as Conservative MPs like Sir Jacob Rees-Mogg.

title: NatWest announces biggest profits since financial crisis
description: HIGHER interest rates have helped NatWest Group make its biggest annual profit since 2007 in what banking reform campaigners have called an “enormous missed opportunity” by the Tories.

title: Liam Gallagher: “We put an offer on the table for Oasis and Noel said no”
description: Speaking exclusively in MOJO magazine, Liam Gallagher says brother Noel turned down an offer to reform Oasis this year.

title: On Calendar Reform
description: Pro cycling has a complicated calendar with more days of racing in a year than actual days. It’s complex in other ways, with confusing blocks of racing at times, the branding of different tiers of event and more. A lot of this is ripe for reform and it’s coming. But easier said than done and be careful what you wish for.

title: Councils demand Right to Buy reform to tackle the housing crisis
description: The Local Government Association (LGA) is urging the government to overhaul the Right to Buy (RTB) scheme which allows council tenants to purchase their homes at a discount, to address the acute shortage of social housing in the country.

title: Greece Becomes First Orthodox Christian Country to Legalize Same-Sex Marriage: 'A Turning Point for Human Rights'
description: A hard-fought bill passed on Thursday also allows same-sex couples to adopt children, in what the conservative prime minister praised as a reflection of Greece's modern-day values

title: Two Labour wins, a Reform party surge and a dip into Rishession: never doubt Sunak’s strategy is going to plan
description: Kingswood likewise “turned the corner” away from the Conservatives to the tune of a 16.4% swing. Furthermore, it was an eye-catching night for Reform, the Tories’ Jill Stein. Or as Rishi Sunak put it this morning: “Our plan is working.”

title: What is behind the rise in popularity of Reform UK – and is it a threat to the main parties?
description: It’s fair to say it’s a rebranded Brexit Party (it may even keep “the Brexit Party” as part of its description on ballot papers). As the successor to the Brexit Party and the spiritual descendant of Ukip, it is a thoroughly Farageist vehicle ...

title: The Tories ‘must adapt’ if they want General Election hope after two by-election drubbings
description: The warning to the PM came after two by-election drubbings. Both Wellingborough, in Northants, and Kingswood, Gloucs, were lost to Labour — with the Tories haemorrhaging votes to Reform. Mr Sunak was told he must appeal to disillusioned Tories with tax ...
